rules_text:
Flying
Haunt [i](When this creature dies, exile it haunting target creature.)[/i]
Creatures haunted by Recurring Poltergeist get +3/+3, have flying, and have “At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature.”
When a creature haunted by Recurring Poltergeist dies, return that card and Recurring Poltergeist to the battlefield under their owners’ control.
notes:
Inspiration — Poltergeists/Hauntings, possession

Mechanical Uniqueness — Haunt as a static effect/enchantment

**Designer note: This is for you Andrew. This card has gone through two or three different iterations by now before settling here. I’m not quite sure where to balance this yet, as if this is the only creature you have when it dies, it *must* stick onto an opponent’s creature — and sometimes you might just stick it onto an opponent’s creature in general. I think it’s rad, but it definitely has a lot of possibilities and interactions.
